body_html:
I'm trying the following PyTorch snippet:

#!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

print(torch.cuda.current_device())

a = Variable(torch.rand(1024, 32)).cuda()
b = Variable(torch.rand(32, 1024)).cuda()

c = torch.mm(a, b)

print(c.data.numpy().shape)

It also gets stuck in a similar way:

open("/proc/self/maps", O_RDONLY)       = 18
fstat(18, {st_mode=S_IFREG|0444, st_size=0, ...}) = 0
mmap(NULL, 4096, PROT_READ|PROT_WRITE, MAP_PRIVATE|MAP_ANONYMOUS, -1, 0) = 0x2b24b6661000
read(18, "00400000-00634000 r-xp 00000000 "..., 1024) = 1024
read(18, "001d000 09:01 1721791           "..., 1024) = 1024
read(18, "               /lib64/libbz2.so."..., 1024) = 1024
read(18, "17                        /lib64"..., 1024) = 1024
read(18, "         /usr/lib64/libssl.so.1."..., 1024) = 1024
close(18)                               = 0
munmap(0x2b24b6661000, 4096)            = 0
mmap(0x2aca5000000, 4294967296, PROT_NONE, MAP_PRIVATE|MAP_ANONYMOUS, -1, 0) = -1 ENOMEM (Cannot allocate memory)
mmap(0x2aca5000000, 1103806595072, PROT_NONE, MAP_PRIVATE|MAP_ANONYMOUS, -1, 0) = -1 ENOMEM (Cannot allocate memory)

body_text:
I'm trying the following PyTorch snippet:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

print(torch.cuda.current_device())

a = Variable(torch.rand(1024, 32)).cuda()
b = Variable(torch.rand(32, 1024)).cuda()

c = torch.mm(a, b)

print(c.data.numpy().shape)
It also gets stuck in a similar way:

body:
I'm trying the following PyTorch snippet:

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

print(torch.cuda.current_device())

a = Variable(torch.rand(1024, 32)).cuda()
b = Variable(torch.rand(32, 1024)).cuda()

c = torch.mm(a, b)

print(c.data.numpy().shape)
```

It also gets stuck in a similar way:

```
open("/proc/self/maps", O_RDONLY)       = 18
fstat(18, {st_mode=S_IFREG|0444, st_size=0, ...}) = 0
mmap(NULL, 4096, PROT_READ|PROT_WRITE, MAP_PRIVATE|MAP_ANONYMOUS, -1, 0) = 0x2b24b6661000
read(18, "00400000-00634000 r-xp 00000000 "..., 1024) = 1024
```
